widgets_values:
1
00:00:00,000 --> 00:00:00,720
Hello everyone

2
00:00:00,720 --> 00:00:01,760
I am Sam Fading

3
00:00:02,080 --> 00:00:05,120
Today, I'm going to share an AI image generation tool with you

4
00:00:05,599 --> 00:00:07,839
It can generate ultra-realistic AI images

5
00:00:08,720 --> 00:00:10,720
I'm using Wanite Hub here

1
00:00:00,000 --> 00:00:00,720
Hello everyone

2
00:00:00,720 --> 00:00:01,760
I am Sam Fading

3
00:00:02,080 --> 00:00:05,120
Today, I am going to share an AI image generation tool with you

4
00:00:05,599 --> 00:00:07,839
It can generate ultra-realistic AI images

5
00:00:08,720 --> 00:00:10,720
I'm using Wanite Hub here

6
00:00:10,960 --> 00:00:12,720
It's also the AI platform I use the most

7
00:00:13,199 --> 00:00:15,359
There are tons of AI apps and workflows available here

8
00:00:15,839 --> 00:00:17,679
I have a special fan benefit to share

9
00:00:18,079 --> 00:00:22,079
Register using the link in my bio to get 1,000 points

10
00:00:22,399 --> 00:00:23,920
Login daily to get 100 points

11
00:00:24,800 --> 00:00:27,519
First, let me demonstrate how to use this tool

12
00:00:28,160 --> 00:00:28,960
There are two ways to do this

13
00:00:29,280 --> 00:00:31,519
One is using the web version on a computer

14
00:00:32,560 --> 00:00:35,280
Let me show you how to use the desktop version first

15
00:00:36,000 --> 00:00:39,840
First, copy the link in my bio and open it in your web browser

16
00:00:40,159 --> 00:00:41,280
Then register

17
00:00:41,679 --> 00:00:43,359
Then enter this interface

18
00:00:43,679 --> 00:00:46,079
Enter your prompt here

19
00:00:46,159 --> 00:00:48,560
which is the content you want to generate

20
00:00:49,200 --> 00:00:50,719
Then just click Run

21
00:00:51,200 --> 00:00:54,479
The second method is to use the web version directly on your phone

22
00:00:55,439 --> 00:00:57,280
Copy the link in my bio

23
00:00:57,600 --> 00:01:00,320
and open it in your phone's browser

24
00:01:00,320 --> 00:01:01,359
You can see this interface

25
00:01:02,000 --> 00:01:03,439
Enter your phone number to register

26
00:01:04,319 --> 00:01:06,959
After registering, you'll see this interface

27
00:01:07,280 --> 00:01:08,640
Then scroll down

28
00:01:09,120 --> 00:01:10,799
Enter your prompt here

29
00:01:11,840 --> 00:01:15,680
Then click Run after entering your prompt

30
00:01:16,560 --> 00:01:21,120
Now, let me introduce the workflow behind this tool

31
00:01:22,560 --> 00:01:26,879
This workflow uses Z Image Base and Z Image Turbo dual sampling

32
00:01:27,680 --> 00:01:31,040
Finally, it uses Flux Client for super-resolution and detail enhancement

33
00:01:35,920 --> 00:01:38,239
First, let's look at the tattoo image part

34
00:01:38,959 --> 00:01:43,840
In the first stage of sampling, we use the Z Image Base model

35
00:01:45,599 --> 00:01:48,560
As we all know, the Base model allows for 'card drawing'

36
00:01:49,439 --> 00:01:51,920
This means when we change the random seed

37
00:01:51,920 --> 00:01:53,920
the resulting images will be very different

38
00:01:54,799 --> 00:01:58,079
Unlike the Turbo model, it won't result in homogenization

39
00:01:59,519 --> 00:02:02,239
I did an experiment here

40
00:02:03,120 --> 00:02:03,920
You can take a look

41
00:02:05,040 --> 00:02:07,200
The top one is generated by the Base model

42
00:02:07,359 --> 00:02:09,599
The bottom one is generated by the Turbo model

43
00:02:10,800 --> 00:02:16,000
The difference between these two images is that they use different random seeds

44
00:02:16,479 --> 00:02:17,759
But with the same prompt

45
00:02:18,960 --> 00:02:24,400
As you can see, when the Base model generates two images with different random seeds

46
00:02:25,199 --> 00:02:28,560
the overall structure and color tone change significantly

47
00:02:28,639 --> 00:02:30,719
Whereas the Turbo model is exactly the opposite

48
00:02:31,120 --> 00:02:31,360
Because the Turbo model is an acceleration model

49
00:02:31,360 --> 00:02:38,879
It leads to images that look the same, even if different random seeds are used

50
00:02:39,599 --> 00:02:41,199
resulting in homogenization

51
00:02:42,800 --> 00:02:44,000
This applies to portraits as well

52
00:02:46,800 --> 00:02:50,080
So for the first stage of sampling, we use the Base model here

53
00:02:50,479 --> 00:02:52,719
to increase the diversity of the output

54
00:02:54,560 --> 00:02:56,000
However, the Base model has a downside

55
00:02:56,879 --> 00:02:58,960
Because it requires a high number of sampling steps

56
00:02:59,360 --> 00:03:00,639
It needs 30 to 50 steps

57
00:03:01,360 --> 00:03:03,039
This makes the image generation speed relatively slow

58
00:03:03,972 --> 00:03:06,292
So in the subsequent sampling

59
00:03:06,292 --> 00:03:07,651
we use the Turbo model

60
00:03:08,852 --> 00:03:12,372
Because the Turbo model's feature is that it can accelerate

61
00:03:15,491 --> 00:03:16,692
In the AI generation process

62
00:03:16,931 --> 00:03:19,812
the first half of the sampling generates the rough outline of the image

63
00:03:20,051 --> 00:03:20,771
which is blurry

64
00:03:21,171 --> 00:03:22,051
As you can see

65
00:03:22,132 --> 00:03:22,611
the result of the first half of sampling looks like this

66
00:03:22,611 --> 00:03:27,891
while the second half actually enriches the details

67
00:03:27,891 --> 00:03:29,092
including the denoising process

68
00:03:29,572 --> 00:03:32,372
You can see the second half slowly enriches the details

69
00:03:34,211 --> 00:03:39,412
So the first few steps of sampling actually determine the rough composition and outline of the image

70
00:03:40,051 --> 00:03:43,092
Using the diversity of our Base model at this stage

71
00:03:43,491 --> 00:03:46,931
allows our final images to achieve a 'card-drawing' effect

72
00:03:47,491 --> 00:03:50,852
meaning our final images are more diverse

73
00:03:54,132 --> 00:03:54,372
Finally, let's look at the super-resolution part

74
00:03:54,372 --> 00:03:59,252
This uses a Flux Client workflow

75
00:03:59,651 --> 00:04:00,532
It's an image-to-image workflow

76
00:04:01,572 --> 00:04:03,572
As you can see, the prompt is quite simple

77
00:04:05,812 --> 00:04:08,132
Let's look at the comparison results before and after super-resolution

78
00:04:09,412 --> 00:04:10,292
This is after super-resolution

79
00:04:10,451 --> 00:04:11,331
This is before super-resolution

80
00:04:15,171 --> 00:04:17,812
You can see that it's not just simple super-resolution

81
00:04:18,531 --> 00:04:20,932
but also adds various details to the character's face

82
00:04:21,492 --> 00:04:21,732
I think this is one of the most amazing features of Flux Client

83
00:04:21,732 --> 00:04:28,132
The final images look very realistic too

Hello everyone. I'm SevenFading. Today I'm sharing an AI image generation tool with you.

nodes.title: Notification
widgets_values: Providing a pure human voice audio in the target language as ref_audio will yield better results.

nodes.title: Notification
widgets_values:
If you want to use this audio as ref_audio, please ensure that the audio is pure human voice without background noise and BGM.

Using audio in the target language as ref_audio will yield better results.

You are a professional subtitle translation expert.

Please translate all the subtitle content in this SRT subtitle file into English. 保持每个字幕内容和时间戳不变。Please directly output the content in SRT format without any explanations or descriptive text.
